intro: Noccaea graeca, commonly known as Greek honesty, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Noccaea graeca is known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
